definition[0]: to happen or arrive in large numbers or quantities
example[0]: As the result of our appeal, the money came rolling in.
definition[1]: to arrive, especially later than usual or expected
example[1]: Chris finally rolled in at about 4:00 am.
definition[2]: if mist, clouds etc roll in, they begin to cover an area of the sky or land
example[2]: Fog rolled in from the sea.
definition[3]: if money or orders are rolling in, they are arriving in large quantities
example[3]: Orders are rolling in from all over Europe.
